step1.sentence: She did not want to bring up the argument again, so she changed the subject.

step2.story: During dinner, the youngest child brought up a question that made everyone at the table go quiet. She had asked simply why some of their neighbors had moved away last year.

step3.story: At the team meeting, everyone was focused on the project deadline. Then a new employee named Ray brought up a concern about the budget that nobody had thought to mention. At first, some people looked slightly annoyed at the interruption. But after a few minutes of discussion, everyone agreed it was an important point that needed to be addressed.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 화제나 문제를 말 중에 언급하다; 아이를 양육하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 대화나 회의 중에 새로운 주제나 문제를 꺼낼 때, 또는 아이를 기른다는 뜻으로 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: bring(가져오다)과 up(위로, 앞으로)이 결합하여 무언가를 대화의 앞으로 끌어온다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 언급하다는 뜻으로 쓸 때는 이전에 논의되지 않은 새로운 주제를 꺼낼 때 자주 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He brought up a really good point about the project timeline.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 프로젝트 일정에 대해 정말 좋은 지적을 했어요.
